Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Interface TLSInfo

public interface TLSInfo
Provides information about a TLS connection.

This interface exposes details about the negotiated TLS session, including the protocol version, cipher suite, and certificates. It is available via ConnectionInfo.getTLSInfo() when the connection is secure.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • ConnectionInfo

    Method

  • Method Details

    • getProtocol

      String getProtocol()
      Returns the TLS protocol version.
      Returns:
      the protocol name, e.g., "TLSv1.2" or "TLSv1.3"

    • getCipherSuite

      String getCipherSuite()
      Returns the negotiated cipher suite.
      Returns:
      the cipher suite name, e.g., "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384"

    • getPeerCertificates

      Certificate[] getPeerCertificates()
      Returns the peer's certificate chain.

      For client connections, this is the server's certificate chain. The first certificate is the peer's own certificate, followed by any certificate authority certificates.

      Returns:
      the peer's certificates, or null if not available

    • getLocalCertificates

      Certificate[] getLocalCertificates()
      Returns the local certificate chain sent to the peer.

      This is only available if client certificate authentication was used. For most client connections, this will be null.

      Returns:
      the local certificates, or null if not sent

    • isSessionResumed

      boolean isSessionResumed()
      Returns whether TLS session resumption was used.

      Session resumption allows faster connection establishment by reusing cryptographic parameters from a previous session.

      Returns:
      true if the session was resumed

    • getALPNProtocol

      String getALPNProtocol()
      Returns the negotiated ALPN (Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation) protocol.

      ALPN allows the client and server to negotiate which application protocol to use over the TLS connection. Common values include:

      • "h2" - HTTP/2
      • "http/1.1" - HTTP/1.1
      Returns:
      the negotiated protocol, or null if ALPN was not used
